pullRequest.body:
Refactor most proofs of `Probability/Distributions/Exponential.lean` in terms of the proofs in `Probability/Distributions/Gamma.lean`, as the exponential distribution is a special case of the Gamma distribution.

Adds `stronglyMeasurable_gammaPdfReal` to `Probability/Distributions/Gamma` and [@measurability] tags to the necessary results in `Probability/Distributions/Gamma` and `Probability/Distributions/Exponential. ` 

Style : improve consistency in notation.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> Thanks!
> 
> Can you please restore `stronglyMeasurable_exponentialPdfReal`? Many lemmas about real valued functions ask for strongly measurable so that's good to have (even if it is easily obtainable from the other one). Also can you add the `[measurability]` tags to both lemmas? That makes those lemmas available in the measurability tactic.

Thank you, I will do that and incorporate the other replies as well! I’ll also add the related result to Probability/Distributions/Gamma!

I've implemented all changes in the PR! 

I think that two further things for exponential/gamma distributions should be modified: 
- The case (a = 0 or r = 0) is a degenerate special case (where the corresponding distribution is the dirac distribution at 0), perhaps we should extend the results, where possible, for that? 
- The parameters for 'a' and 'r' should be positive or non-negative (depending on the previous item), so perhaps we should constrain them to be NNReal at some point: I think from the point where we define gammaMeasure and exponentialMeasure in Probability/Distributions/Gamma and Probability/Distributions/Exponential respectively? 

I'm happy to open a new PR after this one to incorporate these points, or tag them along to the current PR. If you'd like to discuss them, I'm also happy to move that discussion to Zulip?

> Remove `stronglyMeasurable_exponentialPdfReal` as this is a one-line result.

Is this still accurate? If not, please update the top comment. It will become the commit message when this PR is merged into `master`.

> > Remove `stronglyMeasurable_exponentialPdfReal` as this is a one-line result.
> 
> Is this still accurate? If not, please update the top comment. It will become the commit message when this PR is merged into `master`.

That is outdated, I've changed it! I'll incorporate your reviews soon!

Let's merge this and put further changes in another PR. Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7465651583/job/20315297726)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7465651583/job/20315298269)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7465651583/job/20315298834)

Thanks!

Can you please restore `stronglyMeasurable_exponentialPdfReal`? Many lemmas about real valued functions ask for strongly measurable so that's good to have (even if it is easily obtainable from the other one).
Also can you add the `[measurability]` tags to both lemmas? That makes those lemmas available in the measurability tactic.

Thanks!

Can you please restore `stronglyMeasurable_exponentialPdfReal`? Many lemmas about real valued functions ask for strongly measurable so that's good to have (even if it is easily obtainable from the other one).
Also can you add the `[measurability]` tags to both lemmas? That makes those lemmas available in the measurability tactic.

```suggestion
lemma exponentialCdfReal_eq_integral {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r) (x : ℝ) :
```

```suggestion
lemma exponentialCdfReal_eq_lintegral {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r) (x : ℝ) :
```
Please use `exact` instead of `apply` when it closes the goal. But here you can simply delete the `by` at the end of the previous line and delete the `apply`.
Same here: remove `by` and `apply`. In general, prefer `exact` over `apply` for closing a goal.

```suggestion
lemma lintegral_exponentialPdf_eq_antiDeriv {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r) (x : ℝ) :
```

```suggestion
/-- The CDF of the exponential distribution equals `1 - exp (-(r * x))` -/
```

```suggestion
  rw [exponentialCdfReal_eq_lintegral hr, lintegral_exponentialPdf_eq_antiDeriv hr x,
    ENNReal.toReal_ofReal_eq_iff]
```

```suggestion
    exact mul_nonneg hr.le h
```

There is a variant with an implicit argument:
```suggestion
  · exact le_rfl
```

```suggestion
Define the Gamma measure over the reals.
```
One docstring says `gamma Pdf`, the other `Gamma pdf`. Please make the capitalization consistent. (Also see other parts of the file.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Probability/Distributions/Exponential): exponential distrubtion as special case of Gamma distribution
